etymology.description: Depicts bones -> original form of 骨(骨) (gǔ, "bone")
etymology.interpretation: The character 冎 is a pictogram representing bones, which later evolved into the character 骨(骨) (gǔ, "bone"). It visually conveys the shape of bones, illustrating its intended meaning effectively.

examples.chinese: 墓室里静默地躺着一块冎(墓室裡靜默地躺著一塊冎)。
examples.pinyin: Mùshì lǐ jìngmò de tǎngzhe yī kuài guǎ.
examples.english: A bone lay silently in the tomb chamber.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在遗址中偶然发现了冎(考古學家在遺址中偶然發現了冎)，并记录下这块冎的奇特纹理(並記錄下這塊冎的奇特紋理)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zài yízhǐ zhōng ǒurán fāxiàn le guǎ, bìng jìlù xià zhè kuài guǎ de qítè wénlǐ.
examples.english: Archaeologists accidentally discovered a bone at the site and recorded the bone's peculiar texture.

examples.chinese: 寒冬来临时(寒冬來臨時)，河边冰层下显现出一块冎(河邊冰層下顯現出一塊冎)。
examples.pinyin: Hándōng láilín shí, hébiān bīngcéng xià xiǎnxiàn chū yī kuài guǎ.
examples.english: When the harsh winter arrived, a bone emerged beneath the icy riverbank.
